subject: Failures, Assertion and AssertionError
msgSnippet: I want to correct my last e-mail in this Thread. Test method of calculator should be public void testNegative() throws Exception { try { calc.sqrt(-1);
messageBody:
I want to correct my last e-mail in this Thread.
Test method of calculator should be

public void testNegative() throws Exception {
try {
calc.sqrt(-1);
fail("IllegalArgumenException is expecting");
catch(IllegalArgumenException e){
assert true : "it' ok";
}
}

IllegalArgumenException should be thrown in public sqrt() method. This
is not happened because programmer forgot to do this check. It is the
bug. Instead AssertionError is thrown by the code itself, because
programmer that writed doSqrt() method clearly states that his
precondition is that argument is valid. We should be fails before.
AssertionError shouldn't happen.
